meanings.definition: The quality or state of being imponderable.
meanings.sent1: The imponderability of the situation made it difficult to understand.
meanings.sent2: The imponderability of the concept left everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent3: The imponderability of the mystery added an element of intrigue to the story.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts drifted into the imponderability of the universe.
meanings.sent5: The imponderability of the question lingered in the air, waiting to be solved.

meanings.sent1: The scientist pondered the imponderability of the phenomenon.
meanings.sent2: Imponderabilities like this often leave us questioning the unknown.
meanings.sent3: The imponderability of the situation brought a sense of wonder to the group.
meanings.sent4: His mind was filled with imponderabilities that kept him awake at night.
meanings.sent5: The imponderability of the decision weighed heavily on her mind.
